content.question: Which of the following describes a key difference among the 20 amino acids that are used to make proteins?

choices.label: Only some amino acids have an <math alttext="R group" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mtext>R-group</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.
Only some amino acids have a carboxyl group <math alttext="open parenthesis, C O O H, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>(COOH)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.
Some amino acids contain the element phosphorus.
